Contact Email: careers@icorepioneer.com

Job Published: 03, Dec 2025 Closing Date: 10, Dec 2025

Brief Description

As a Junior AI/Computer Vision Engineer, you will help develop AI models for movement tracking, pose estimation, action recognition, and sports-specific performance insights. You will work closely with senior engineers to build AI components used across multiple sports.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in building and training machine learning and deep learning models for:
  • Player tracking & object detection (YOLO, Detectron2, OpenCV)
  • Pose estimation (OpenPose, Mediapipe, MMPose)
  • Action recognition & event detection in sports videos
  • Participate in dataset gathering, annotation, cleaning, and augmentation.
  • Support the development of pipelines for:
  • Video ingestion
  • Frame processing
  • Feature extraction
  • Model inference
  • Write clean and modular code for model training, evaluation, and deployment.
  • Implement basic data visualization and analytical dashboards.
  • Optimize models for real-time inference on mobile/web applications.
  • Collaborate with product and engineering teams on model integrations.
  • Document research experiments, training metrics, and results.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills

  • Strong programming knowledge in Python.
  • Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow/Keras.
  • Good understanding of machine learning concepts: CNNs, RNNs, transformers.
  • Knowledge of OpenCV for computer vision tasks.
  • Familiarity with one or more:
  • YOLOv5/v8
  • Mediapipe
  • MMPose
  • DeepSORT / ByteTrack (tracking)
  • Exposure to model evaluation techniques (mAP, accuracy, precision, recall).
  • Basic understanding of REST APIs and model deployment (Flask/FastAPI).

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience training vision models on Google Colab / Kaggle / GPU.
  • Understanding of sports rules/biomechanics (bonus).
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms (GCP/AWS/Azure).
  • Familiarity with ONNX, TensorRT, or TFLite for model optimization.

Experience Required: 1-3 years
summary: Junior AI/Computer Vision Engineer to develop models for movement tracking and performance insights in sports. Responsibilities include building, training, and deploying ML models using Python and PyTorch/TensorFlow.

Internal IT Systems Administrator

Closing Date: 03 January 2026 Job Published: 03 December 2025

Brief Description

We are seeking a security-focused and detail-oriented Internal IT Systems Administrator to manage and safeguard our internal IT infrastructure. You'll be responsible for ensuring all systems run smoothly, securely, and efficiently while working closely with HR, Finance, and administrative functions.

Key Responsibilities

Critical Systems Management

  • Ensure email systems and other critical infrastructure maintain 99%+ uptime
  • Monitor and manage email platforms
  • Perform proactive monitoring of all critical business systems
  • Manage VPN infrastructure and firewall configurations
  • Oversee backup systems and verify backup integrity

Security & Compliance

  • Monitor network security and system threats continuously
  • Enforce the company's Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) across all teams
  • Alert team members to security threats and provide guidance on secure practices
  • Research and recommend secure tools and best practices for adoption
  • Stay current with security vulnerabilities and emerging threats

Access & Identity Management

  • Maintain accurate inventory of all user accounts and access permissions
  • Maintain comprehensive tracking of all user accounts
  • Conduct quarterly access reviews with department heads
  • Execute thorough off-boarding processes for security compliance
  • Manage on-boarding IT processes in collaboration with other functions
  • Monitor privileged access accounts usage

IT Asset & Device Management

  • Manage IT asset lifecycle from procurement to secure disposal
  • Configure and secure laptops, test phones, and test devices to company standards
  • Maintain accurate asset inventory and tracking systems
  • Handle asset tagging and stock register management
  • Coordinate e-waste disposal in compliance with security and environmental standards

Cost Optimization & Tool Management

  • Evaluate SaaS subscriptions and license usage regularly
  • Identify opportunities for cost savings through pricing plan optimization
  • Research alternative tools that offer better value or security
  • Track subscription renewals and recommend continue/discontinue decisions
  • Work with teams to right-size tool subscriptions based on actual usage

Daily Operations & Support

  • Respond to employee support requests and break-fix activities
  • Troubleshoot technical issues across various platforms and systems
  • Manage vendor relationships for IT services and products
  • Coordinate procurement processes (PRs, POs) with Finance team

Preferred Skills

Required Qualifications

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or related field. Security certifications strongly preferred.
  • Experience: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in IT systems administration with a security focus. Demonstrated experience in security monitoring and incident response. Proven track record of implementing security best practices. Experience with access management and user provisioning systems. Background in compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, or similar) is a plus.

Technical Skills (Required)

  • Strong knowledge of network security principles and monitoring tools
  • Experience with firewall management and VPN technologies
  • Proficiency in email system administration (Google Workspace, Office 365, Linux mailservers)
  • Understanding of identity and access management (IAM) concepts
  • Familiarity with 2FA/MFA implementation and enforcement
  • Experience with backup and recovery systems
  • Linux and Windows server administration
  • Asset management and inventory tracking systems

Technical Skills (Preferred)

  • SIEM or log management tools experience
  • Vulnerability scanning and assessment tools
  • Security awareness training platforms
  • Scripting for automation (Python, Bash, PowerShell)
  • Cloud security best practices (AWS, Azure, GCP)

Key Competencies

  • Security-First mindset
  • Meticulous attention to detail in tracking and documentation
  • Proactive problem solver who is hands-on
  • Good communication skills and ability to understand business needs
  • Organization and process management

Note: This is an office-based role.

To apply: email jobs@devicedriven.com
summary: Seeking a security-focused IT Systems Administrator to manage and safeguard internal infrastructure. Responsibilities include system uptime, security, access management, and cost optimization.
